definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: Open your mouth and ask if you think something is bothering your spouse.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得你的爱人有什么烦心事，那就开口问问他。

sentences.english: Breus says writing down your worries can reduce anxiety’s grip.
sentences.chinese: 布瑞鲁斯称写下自己的烦心事可以缓解焦虑。

sentences.english: From her choked voice I can tell that something unpleasant has happened to her.
sentences.chinese: 遇到这么多烦心事，我能不发闷吗？

sentences.english: Most recently, he had learned because of distraction Fan Xinshi a good variety of magic.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他因为排遣烦心事而学会了好多种魔术。

sentences.english: How can I be happy when faced with so many troubles?
sentences.chinese: 遇到这么多烦心事，我能不发闷吗？

sentences.english: Only grow up to have real Fan Xinshi.
sentences.chinese: 只有长大了才会有真正的烦心事。

sentences.english: You don't have any of your daily troubles running through your mind.
sentences.chinese: 脑子里不想日常的烦心事。

sentences.english: Originally should sink she who inundates in happiness two nearly actually to have a worrying matter.
sentences.chinese: 本应该沉漫在幸福中的她二近却有一件烦心事。

sentences.english: But there is trouble in paradise.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在这样的天堂里也有烦心事。

sentences.english: Laugh to let it go and move on.
sentences.chinese: 微笑能使烦心事随风而逝，并且继续前进。

sentences.english: The weather has not yet autumn, there are a lot of Fan Xinshi.
sentences.chinese: 天气还没有入秋，烦心事便有了一大堆。

sentences.english: She told me that they tell the Lord God and in their own Fan Xinshi.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶告诉我，他们在和上帝耶和华诉说自己的烦心事。

sentences.english: I'm not fat. It's all this fur. It makes me look poofy.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，那你有“肥毛”如果有烦心事想说，我听着。

sentences.english: If so, you might be one of your boss' pet peeves.
sentences.chinese: 如果真是这样，你可能是老板的烦心事。

sentences.english: A close your eyes, they can not help think of those annoying Fan Xinshi.
sentences.chinese: 一闭上眼睛，便不由自主地想到那些扰人的烦心事。

definition: a load on one's mind/worry/CL:宗[zong1],樁|桩[zhuang1]
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
